member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraControlDesigner.OnControlDoubleClick
member.summary: Protected method that is called when the user double clicks on a point that is design time active.

remarks.p: The default implementation calls DoDefaultAction which will normally bring up the code window.
However, this method can be overridden to prevent this behavior. For example, button type elements would want a double click to generate 2 clicks instead of bringing up the code window.
Note: If the point is over a button or scrollbar element the default implementation does nothing.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.Design.Internal.DataConnectionDialogWrapper.CanShowDialog(System.Exception@)
member.summary: Returns true if the 'Microsoft.Data.ConnectionUI.Dialog.dll' file was able to be copied to a local directory and loaded.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.Design.Internal.DataConnectionDialogWrapper.ShowDialog(Infragistics.Olap.FlatData.FlatDataSourceAdapterType,System.String@,System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window)
member.summary: Uses reflection to invoke the Microsoft.Data.ConnectionUI.DataConnectionDialog.Show method
member.param: [out] Upon return, contains the connection string resulting from this dialog session, or an empty string if the session was canceled.
The owning IWin32Window implementation, i.e., the form from which this dialog was launched.
member.returns: DialogResult.OK if committed, DialogResult.Cancel if canceled.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.Design.Internal.DataConnectionDialogWrapper.GetDialogAssembly(System.Exception@)
member.summary: Loads the 'Microsoft.Data.ConnectionUI.dll' and 'Microsoft.Data.ConnectionUI.Dialog.dll' files from resources, copies them to a local directory, and loads from that location. member.name: M:Infragistics.Shared.Serialization.UltraCodeDomSerializer.ResetLocalNameCache(System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager,System.Object)
member.summary: This is for a workaround to a bug in the DotNet localization logic to handle collections. There is a bug in the CLR2 serialization logic where the names of locals will not be cleared after saving the file. When local name are then regenerated for sub-objects, they need new names because if the cache is not cleared, then it appears the names are already taken. This clears the cache of local names through reflection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraParentControlDesigner.OnControlDoubleClick
member.summary: Protected method that is called when the user double clicks on a point that is design time active.

remarks.p: The default implementation calls DoDefaultAction which will normally bring up the code window.
However, this method can be overridden to prevent this behavior. For example, button type elements would want a double click to generate 2 clicks instead of bringing up the code window.
Note: If the point is over a button or scrollbar element the default implementation does nothing.

member.summary: Provides core functionality for all the methods.

The horizontal position, in design-time view coordinates, of the location of the left edge of the tool, if a size is specified; the horizontal position of the center of the tool, if no size is specified.
The vertical position, in design-time view coordinates, of the location of the top edge of the tool, if a size is specified; the vertical position of the center of the tool, if no size is specified.

The height of the tool. This parameter is ignored if the hasSize parameter is set to false.
true if a location for the component is specified; false if the component is to be positioned in the center of the currently selected control.
true if a size for the component is specified; false if the default height and width values for the component are to be used.
member.returns: An array of components created from the tool.

member.summary: Creates the registry value which stores the file path of the default preset file, if it does not already exist. It also writes the file path of the standard default preset file to the newly created value.

member.summary: Gets the search option for the built-in Standard folder from the Registry.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.GetCustomFolderSearchOption
member.summary: Gets the search option for the built-in Custom folder from the Registry.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.GetPresetsFiles(System.String,Infragistics.Win.PresetType,Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsPlatform,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an ArrayList of PresetInfo objects for the specified 'target type name' on the specified presets platform (i.e., Win or Web)
member.remarks: This method looks for presets files in the standard folders. To find presets files in alternate folders use the overload that takes an array of DirectoryInfo or PresetInfo objects.
member.param: A string representation of the type of the component whose Presets folder is to be returned
The type of presets to return, i.e., Appearance or Behavior
The platform (i.e., Win or Web) that the component runs on
Specify 'true' to return files containing Custom presets or 'false' to return files containing 'Standard' presets.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.GetPresetsFiles(System.String,Infragistics.Win.PresetType,Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetFolderInfo[])
member.summary: Returns an ArrayList of PresetInfo objects for the specified 'target type name' in the specified list of PresetFolderInfos.
member.remarks: This method looks for presets files in a specified list of folders represented by a list of PresetFolderInfo objects. To find presets files in the standard folders use the overload that takes the requested preset platform and an 'IsCustom' flag.
member.param: A string representation of the type of the component whose Presets folder is to be returned
The type of presets to return, i.e., Appearance or Behavior
An array of PresetFolderInfo objects for each folder to be searched.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.GetPresetsFiles(System.String,Infragistics.Win.PresetType,System.IO.DirectoryInfo[])
member.summary: Returns an ArrayList of PresetInfo objects for the specified 'target type name' in the specified list of DirectoryInfos.
member.remarks: This method looks for presets files in a specified list of DirectoryInfos.
member.param: A string representation of the type of the component whose Presets folder is to be returned
The type of presets to return, i.e., Appearance or Behavior
An array of DirectoryInfo objects for each folder to be searched.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.GetPresetsFolderForType(System.String,Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsPlatform,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a DirectoryInfo object for the specified 'target type name' on the specified presets platform (i.e., Win or Web)
member.param: A string representation of the type of the component whose Presets folder is to be returned
The platform (i.e., Win or Web) that the component runs on
Specify 'true' to return the folder containing Custom presets or 'false' to return the folder containing 'Standard' presets.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.Design.PresetsManager.GetUserDefinedPresetsFolders(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an array of PresetFolderInfo objects for each user defined presets folder value found in the specified registry key.
member.param: The registry key that contains the values for user defined presets folders
True to include only those folders marked as active by the user, false to include all user defined presets folders
True to include only those folders which actually exist, false to include all user defined presets folders whether they exist or not
True to remove the registry value for each folder that is returned in the list, false to leave all values.

member.summary: Returns true if the specified path to a Preset file is the path to the default Preset used by the UltraGrid.

member.summary: Returns true if the specified Preset name contains valid characters.
Saves a Preset with the specified information
member.param: The control for which the Preset is being saved.
The folder in which to save the preset
Specifies the action to be taken if a file with the same name already exists in the destination folder.

True to display a message when the Preset is successfully saved.

remarks.p: When a thumb is active, this color is not applicable; SystemColors.Highlight is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.StopEditor.StopEditorControl.ThumbBackColor
member.summary: Returns or sets the background color of the thumbs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.StopEditor.StopEditorControl.ControlUIElement
member.summary: ControlUIElement

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.StopEditor.StopEditorControl.Gutter
member.summary: Returns the padding applied around the StopAreaUIElement.

remarks.p: This is used to make the thumb pointers align with the edges of the StopAreaUIElement, and also to make the thumbs intersect vertically with the bottom border of the StopAreaUIElement.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.StopEditor.StopEditorControl.ThumbSize
member.summary: Returns or sets the size of a stop thumb.

remarks.p: Ideally the height should be twice the value of the width.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.StopEditor.StopEditorControl.StopAreaDrawCallback
member.summary: Returns or sets a function which is called to override the default background drawing for the StopAreaUIElement.

remarks.p: By default, the StopAreaUIElement has a solid background, the color of which is determined by the control's BackColor. Assigning a Func to this property overrides the default drawing; this is used by the DataChart's BrushEditor to draw the gradients inside the stop area.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.StopEditor.StopEditorControl.Tick
member.summary: Returns or sets the value delta for each increment between 0 and 1.

remarks.p: Don't change this after the Stops collection is populated.
This property is similar to a TrackBar's TickFrequency property, except that the value specified here determines the number of units a thumb moves with each movement during a drag operation.
The default value is .05, which makes 20 discrete positions.
Set to zero for pixel-level dragging, i.e., no snapping during drag operations.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.StopEditor.StopEditorControl.Precision
member.summary: Returns or sets the number of decimal places to which the values produced by the control are rounded.

remarks.p: Don't change this after the Stops collection is populated.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Add a Panel control (A lighter-weight container control).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.strings.AddFillPanelDialog_AddUltraPanel
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Add an UltraPanel control (provides ability to control much more of the appearance).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.strings.AddFillPanelDialog_DescriptionForControls
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to The {0} component is initializing and is about to add docking areas to {1}.
It is recommended that a container control with its 'Dock' property set to 'Fill' be added to {1} and that all child controls be re-parented to it. This is not required but will help ensure proper positioning of child controls as the size of the dock areas change.
Would you like to automatically add a panel container control now? .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.strings.AddFillPanelDialog_DescriptionForForms
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to The {0} component is initializing and is about to add docking areas to the form.
It is recommended, for non-MDI forms only, that a container control with its 'Dock' property set to 'Fill' be added to the form and that all child controls be re-parented to it. This is not required but will help ensure proper positioning of child controls as the size of the dock areas change.
Would you like to automatically add a panel container control now? .

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Default is resolved to the SummarySettings.Hidden and SummarySettings.DisplayInGroupBy settings. In other words if those properties are left to their default values, then the summaries will be displayed in the summary footer at the end of each row collection and in each group-by row (not aligned to columns)..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Summary is not visible anywhere.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.strings.FeaturePicker_Desc_Summaries_SummaryDisplayArea_RootRowsFootersOnly
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Only displays the summary footers on the root rows collection (root level). This is useful when rows are grouped and you want to show the summary footers of the root group-by rows. When rows are not grouped this flag has no effect. Note that this does not have any effect on the workings of InGroupByRows option. InGroupByRows will still work the same way regardless of the value of this flag..

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.strings.SaveSchema_Option2_2
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Select this option to save the schema internally and use it to generate bands and columns in the control.
NOTE: If you choose this option then only the keys and positions of the columns and bands will be saved. All other properties will be determined by the DataSource when it is assigned at runtime.
NOTE: The keys of the bands and columns in the schema must match the keys in the DataSource. .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.strings.UltraGridDesignerConfirmSchemaTransferralPrompt
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The grid is already bound to a data source. When you manually define a schema the grid cannot have a data source. Pressing the Yes button will cause the grid's DataSource property to be set to null (Nothing) and the schema of the data source to which it is bound will be transferred to an internal schema maintained by the grid. Pressing the No button will cancel this operation and nothing will be altered. Do you wish to proceed?.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.strings.UltraGridDesignerPresets_lbl_Heading1
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The control provides the ability to select and apply preset groupings of Look and Behavior property settings. Using Presets, you can quickly setup your control to look and behave exactly as you want it to..

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.strings.UltraGridDesignerPresets_lbl_Heading2
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to For example, using Presets you could design your control to have a gradient look with specific shades of blue, an OutlookGroupBy style with no row selectors or treelines, and do it all with 2 mouse clicks - i.e., 1 to select the Preset and 1 to apply it to the control..

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.strings.UltraGridDesignerPresets_lbl_Heading3
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to There are 3 type of Presets: ones that contain Look related properties only, ones that contain behavior related properties only and ones that contain both. The control includes a number of built-in Presets of all 3 types. In addition, you can modify an existing Preset and save it under a new name as well as design your own presets from scratch..

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.strings.UltraGridDesignerPresets_lbl_Heading4
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Note that when applying a Preset, you have the option of resetting or preserving existing property settings (if any)..

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.Design.strings.UltraGridDesignerPresets_lbl_Heading5
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Click 'Manage Presets...' to select and apply a Preset to the control or to save the control's current property settings as a Preset..

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinTabControl.Design.UltraTabControlBaseDesigner.CreateToolCore(System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Provides core functionality for all the System.Windows.Forms.Design.ParentControlDesigner.CreateTool(System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem) methods.
member.param: The System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem to create a component from.

The horizontal position, in design-time view coordinates, of the location of the left edge of the tool, if a size is specified; the horizontal position of the center of the tool, if no size is specified.
The vertical position, in design-time view coordinates, of the location of the top edge of the tool, if a size is specified; the vertical position of the center of the tool, if no size is specified.
The width of the tool. This parameter is ignored if the hasSize parameter is set to false.
The height of the tool. This parameter is ignored if the hasSize parameter is set to false.
true if a location for the component is specified; false if the component is to be positioned in the center of the currently selected control.
true if a size for the component is specified; false if the default height and width values for the component are to be used.
member.returns: An array of components created from the tool.
